msContents.summary: Account of grain; the statement of the purpose is not preserved

msItem.note: Written along the fibers with 20 lines; the back is blank; the surface is badly rubbed

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from Mr. Blanchard through H.I. Bell in 1924; no. 34 in Bell's inventory

div.ab:
(from line 3)
through Mari... Total, 79 1/3 artabas. From which ... ... Anouphis ... brother with Herakles, 4 1/3 artabas. Balance, 70 (+) artabas. On account of Arabikos, 16 artabas. Ptolemaios, 1 1/2 artabas. On account of Herakles, 3 artabas. For insolvent persons (?), .. artabas. Total, 102 2/3 artabas. From which, a receipt of Pachoutes ... Anouphis through Api... Venaphris ... Ammoni... Paulos, 1 artaba, Pankratis. Receipt for 2 1/2, 1/12 artabas. Amaeis, 12 2/3 artabas. Total, 74 1/4 artabas. Balance, 28 1/3 1/12 artabas.

listBibl.bibl: P.Col. VII 133 Plate, P.Col. VII, Microfiche 1
